text: Infatuation is the psychological state of being strongly attracted to another person. ==Ideas== ===Frank D. Cox=== Psychologist Frank D. Cox said that infatuation was different from romantic love as infatuation did not always lead to an intimate relationship.Frank D. Cox, Human Intimacy (2008) p. 72. ===Andrew Goldstein and Marianne Brandon=== Dr. Andrew Goldstein and clinical psychologist Marianne Brandon described infatuation as the first stage of a relationship becoming mature intimacy.A. Goldstein and M. Brandon, Reclaiming Desire (2009) p. 232. ===Temi Adebowale=== In journalist Temi Adebowale's view, while love is "a warm attachment, enthusiasm, or devotion to another person", infatuation is "a feeling of foolish or obsessively strong love for, admiration for, or interest in someone or something", a shallower "honeymoon phase" in a relationship. ===Ian Kerner=== Ian Kerner, a sex therapist, stated that infatuation usually occurred at the beginning of a relationship, which is ==Types== Three types of infatuation have been identified.
